intro: Prockia albicans, commonly known as the white prockia, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its delicate, white petals and small, clustered leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Prockia albicans is known for its short blooming period in late spring, producing fragrant flowers that attract pollinators. Its botanical features make it a sought-after plant in ornamental horticulture.
